At the Louvre, tension builds over creation of new 'Mona Lisa' gallery
subhead: The Louvre-Nouvelle Renaissance architecture competition aims to create a room for Leonardo da Vinci's iconic painting and a new entrance for the Paris museum, which has seen a surge in visitors. Five teams have been shortlisted, none of which are French.

Mamdani, inaugurated as New York mayor, must now deliver on promises that secured his victory
subhead: The young politician, the first Muslim to lead the largest city in the US and firmly on the left, filled his inauguration ceremony on Thursday with symbolic gestures. Elected on a pledge to make New York more affordable, he said he intends to govern 'expansively and audaciously.'

title: Switzerland in shock after tragic bar fire: 'It was a war zone. Burned hair, faces and hands'
subhead: The upscale French-speaking Alpine resort of Crans-Montana is in mourning after a fire in a bar claimed the lives of around 40 people and left 115 others seriously injured. Heart-wrenching testimonies and unanswered questions are pouring in.

title: Poland's iconic 1989 round table consigned to museum
subhead: This symbolic piece of furniture, on which communist leaders and democratic activists reached agreement, is leaving the presidential palace. The decision by nationalist President Karol Nawrocki is sparking debate in the country.

title: China's plan for London mega-embassy stokes controversy
subhead: Beijing acquired Royal Mint Court in 2018 with the aim of relocating its embassy in the United Kingdom there. Housing Minister Steve Reed had until December 10 to make a decision on this major project, but the deadline was postponed for the third consecutive time to January 2026.

Early Christian fresco depicting Jesus as the Good Shepherd discovered in Turkey
subhead: One month after Pope Leo XIV's visit, Turkish authorities announced the discovery in Iznik, Anatolia, of a depiction of Christ in a well-preserved burial chamber.

title: Bulgaria joins the euro divided, in political crisis and without a budget
subhead: The Balkan country adopted the European single currency on January 1, but the population remains unenthusiastic. The country only has a caretaker government and corruption is endemic.

title: In Brazil, love vibrates at the heart of society
subhead: Traditions around love have long spilled beyond the realm of intimacy to shape the social, political and even collective identity of the country, writes Le Monde's correspondent Bruno Meyerfeld in his final dispatch.
